de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.tablet

Class TabletDragTabsEventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.AbstractTouchEventHandler
      • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback>
        • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.tablet.TabletDragTabsEventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<AbstractTouchEventHandler>

    public class TabletDragTabsEventHandler
extends AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback>
    A drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the tablet layout.
    Since:
    1.0.0

      Creates a new drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the tablet layout.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TabletDragTabsEventHandler

        public TabletDragTabsEventHandler(@NonNull
                                  TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                  @NonNull
                                  Arithmetics arithmetics,
                                  @NonNull
                                  de.mrapp.android.util.view.AttachedViewRecycler<AbstractItem,?> viewRecycler)
        Creates a new drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the tablet layout.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, whose tabs' positions and states should be calculated by the drag handler, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null
        arithmetics - The arithmetics, which should be used to calculate the position, size and rotation of tabs, as an instance of the type Arithmetics. The arithmetics may not be null
        viewRecycler - The view recycler, which allows to inflate the views, which are used to visualize the tabs, whose positions and states should be calculated by the tab switcher, as an instance of the class AttachedViewRecycler. The view recycler may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • getTouchableArea

        @NonNull
public final android.graphics.RectF getTouchableArea()
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns the bounds of the onscreen area, the handler takes into consideration for handling touch events. Touch events that occur outside of the area are clipped. By default, the area is not restricted. Subclasses may override this method in order to restrict the area.
        Overrides:
        getTouchableArea in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns:
        The bounds of the onscreen area, the handler takes into consideration for handling touch events, as an instance of the class RectF or null, if the area is not restricted

      • getFocusedItem

        @Nullable
protected final AbstractItem getFocusedItem(float position)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDragTabsEventHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to retrieve the item, which corresponds to the view, which is focused when clicking/dragging at a specific position.
        Specified by:
        getFocusedItem in class AbstractDragTabsEventHandler<AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.Callback>
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The item, which corresponds to the focused view, as an instance of the class AbstractItem or null, if no view is focused
